page.title: 01TEESSIDE AIRPORT ENVIRONS
page.content:
The area consists of 10x1km squares of{farmland}to the north, which are dominated by 2x1km squares containing {Teeside Airport}to the south.
Individual farmhouses exist in these squares,as well as some residential houses in the west, which were once part of the officers quarters when the airfield belonged to the RAF. To the east there is part of the British Chrome Chemicals plant,next to the railway line which runs west-east across the whole area and includes one station at the airport. Many of the original RAF buildings at the airport have diversified with many new uses, eg the airport hotel, a tennis and sports centre, a fire training centre, an old people's home, a flying school and student homes.
